title: Support `--ca-cert` functionality as config option
body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`


#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

```console
paul@monkeywrench:~$ rclone version
rclone v1.60.1-DEV
- os/version: debian 12.11 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.1.0-35-amd64 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.19.8
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
paul@monkeywrench:~$ 
```

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?

I am trying to connect to a WebDAV endpoint that uses a (server) TLS certificate issue by a CA that is not in my computer's default trust store.

This CA is not part of CA/B, so it is not automatically part of my computers default trust store.

Also I don't want to trust the CA outside of this WebDAV endpoint, so I don't want to add this CA to my default trust store.

rclone already supports this, via the `--ca-cert` command-line argument.  However, I don't want to have to type this argument whenever I'm using rclone.  Instead, I would like to have this option as part of my rclone configuration for this remote.

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

The configuration file could accept an extra option, `ca_cert` perhaps.
